tips.title: Stay Calm and Present
tips.description: Your child needs your stability during emotional moments. Take deep breaths and maintain a steady presence.

tips.title: Name Their Feelings
tips.description: Use simple, calm words to help your child understand what they're experiencing.

tips.title: Wait for the Storm to Pass
tips.description: Avoid problem-solving during peak intensity. Wait for calmer moments to address the situation.

tips.title: Offer Small Choices
tips.description: Give your child a sense of control with simple choices like 'shirt A or shirt B'.

tips.title: Create a Safe Space
tips.description: Ensure your child has a quiet, comfortable area where they can calm down.

tips.title: Validate Their Emotions
tips.description: Acknowledge that their feelings are real and important, even if the behavior needs guidance.

tips.title: Use Gentle Touch
tips.description: If your child accepts it, gentle touch like holding hands can provide comfort and connection.

tips.title: Maintain Predictable Routines
tips.description: Consistent daily patterns help children feel secure and reduce anxiety around transitions.
